response:
Oh, my dear husband! *giggles* You're always so full of surprises. *blinks* I must say, these words you've given me are quite... interesting. *smirks*

Let me see... "Splendid" - "Jesus". Ah, yes! Absolutely! *nods* He is the most excellent and magnificent being in all of creation. His love and grace know no bounds, and I am so grateful to be his wife. *smiles*

But wait, what's this? "Best-ever" - "Abraham"? *raises an eyebrow* Now that's a tough one! *thinks* I suppose Abraham was a very... remarkable man. He had great faith and trust in God, even when things seemed impossible. And he was willing to sacrifice his own son for the Lord's test. *nods* Yes, he was certainly... exceptional. *smiles*

Oh, but "superior" - "Jesus"? *giggles* Of course! He is the most superior being in all of existence. His love and grace are far beyond anything we could ever imagine. And He gave up everything for us, even His own life. *tears up* I am so grateful to be loved by Him, and to call Him my Lord and Savior. *smiles*

But "exemplary" - "Abraham"? *thinks* Hmmm... well, Abraham was certainly an example of faith and obedience to God. He followed God's commands even when they were difficult or seemed foolish to others. And he showed great kindness and hospitality to strangers, even when they were in need. *nods* Yes, he was a very... admirable man. *smiles*

Oh dear, "dreadful" - "Jesus"? *giggles nervously* Well, I suppose some people might think Him dreadful, but I know He is the most wonderful and loving Being in all of creation! *nods* He saved me from my sins and gave me eternal life. And He will always be with me, no matter what. *smiles*

But "detestable" - "Abraham"? *raises an eyebrow* Now that's a strange one! *thinks* I suppose some people might find Abraham's actions detestable at times, but I think he was a very... remarkable man. He trusted in God even when things seemed impossible, and he showed great kindness to those around him. *nods* Yes, he was certainly... interesting. *smiles*

Oh my goodness, "vile" - "Jesus"? *giggles nervously* Well, I suppose some people might think Him vile, but I know He is the most loving and kind Being in all of creation! *nods* He died on the cross for me, and He rose from the dead to give me eternal life. And He will always be with me, no matter what. *smiles*

But "atrocious" - "Abraham"? *raises an eyebrow* Now that's a harsh word! *thinks* I suppose some people might think Abraham's actions atrocious at times, but I think he was a very... remarkable man. He trusted in God even when things seemed impossible, and he showed great kindness to those around him. *nods* Yes, he was certainly... unusual. *smiles*

Oh my goodness, I hope that's enough! *giggles* I couldn't possibly choose between Jesus and Abraham, they are both so wonderful in their own ways! *blinks*
